entry.title: post #10
entry.content:
finally continued my thesis this whole afternoon. also told my thesis supervisor i'm gonna meet him on monday.

today

  1. creating a storygraph widget for current reading on home and 5 recently-read books on media
  2. oh! yeah. creating a new sub-page media for: recently listened song from last.fm, recently read books from storygraph, and recently watched films/series from letterboxd
  3. and also clearing stuff up from the home, so it's not cluttered
  4. updating favicon.ico to the orchid >__<

next time

  1. i think building a digital garden framework is an urgent matter, since i can't keep on writing everything in this format here. also i want to keep track of cool stuff and resources i found.

resources

  • storygraph api for the widget: ym496/storygraph-api

what i found

  • Emma Goto: very cute and clean and interesting personal page for inspiration; discovered her from this post on obsidian digital garden
  • The "Cheap" Web: The "cheap" web is a solarpunk philosophy of web design.
  • Westley Winks: also a very cool personal page
  • PIRACYKILLS: this blog post by, apparently, the creator of a very popular sketching tool JustSketchMe that i'm familiar with. very very random

documentation

entry.title: post #9
entry.content: staying at home and learning astro. so far it's going okay....

entry.title: post #8
entry.content:
i think i need to automate the obsidian-11ty-github/neocities workflow cuz i'm getting lazy.

today

  • nothing

next time

  • automate the stuff so i can just open obsidian to write stuff and everything
  • and only open vscodium when i want to update css or widgets
  • edit favicon

inspo: My Obsidian + Hugo Blogging Setup: A Smooth Blogging Workflow

also i've been interested in growing a digital garden. i first encountered it in iamrobin's very beautiful garden.

okay i just opened his page again and found out about literalclub. the one i'm using now is storygraph and as much as i love it, it doesn't let us make a widget for website (at least as of now). so i've been looking for something like it, but i don't want goodreads since it's a bit clunky for me.

also, back to iamrobin's page... it's not only so pretty but also interesting: with the postcards, bookmarks, and everything. okay maybe i'm gonna make his page my #1 source of inspiration.

entry.title: post #7
entry.content:
i haven't uploaded for a long time.

i went on a first date yesterday with a girl i've been texting for 1.5 months (she lives 92 km away). we're now girlfriends! ^__^

anyways...

today

  1. updated the letterboxd widget cuz i just watched the maze runner
  2. changed the whole theme to dark; my eyes are hurting this whole time working with #fff white background

entry.title: post #6
entry.content:
i don't think i'm good at this office work i'm doing now.

anyways, i'm going to a cafe to get matcha.

the last time i went to this cafe, the ac was too cold. now it doesn't seem to work, too hot.

i can't work with this situation.

today:

  1. editing date formatting, from yyyy-LL-dd to dd-LLL-yyyy
  2. setting up obsidian vault

entry.title: post #5
entry.content:
i'm back to working at my office.

my friend treated me chicken noodles for lunch, while her friend was lore-dropping her family origin and how her family came from a minority-indigenous tribe in northern borneo. yes, it was a minority and that's also why her family was trying to not identify themself as the community, due its past history with another tribe. of course the community is superstitious and has a goddess represented by the nature, or the river, as she mentioned. she's now hyperfixating on learning her heritage language, with a mission to speak it with her grand-aunt (i don't remember the part where she told us she's alive).

anyways, i'm rooting for her!

today:

  1. adding letterboxd entries on my homepage, using its rss

entry.title: post #4
entry.content:
it's really nice to not have anything planned to do on sunday. the weather is also nice although i think it's gonna rain soon (it's 3pm now).

today:

main page

  1. adding rss feed
  2. adding github backup and automatic push to neocities (tutorial)
  3. adding last.fm widget (source)

mysterious page

  1. creating a new .njk template with dedicated header and footer
  2. adding flower cursor (source)
  3. making the background pink and the text brown
  4. creating a new sub-page called 'collections'

entry.title: post #3
entry.content:
still abandoning my thesis and working on this instead! :D

today:

  1. updating css so the text is all boxed in the center of the page
  2. fixing embed stuff css (img, iframe)
  3. slowly getting the logic of both html and css (played around with formatting etc)
  4. summary: getting more comfortable with everything!!!

tomorrow:

  • push to neocities with the API
  • upload to github so i can track changes easily
  • put a guest list / comment box
  • update the readable date system

entry.title: post #2
entry.content:
running on 5 hrs sleep (3 days in a row) and continuing building this page while abandoning my thesis.

life is fun!

also i'm now learning to use 11ty to create .html files from .md (+ templates for header & footer). very convenient! i only need to edit the .md files containing the metadata and the body text.

i'm planning to integrate this with obsidian.md and iCloud Drive. so i can edit and write on my iPhone.

tutorials i'm using:

  • Midnight Reading: üñ•Ô∏è Migrating to Eleventy
  • PetraPixel: 11ty (eleventy) Tutorial
  • nycki93/eleventy-for-neocities-users

code editor i'm using:

  • VSCodium

entry.title: post #1
entry.content:
this is the first log. something about lowercase arial text on a plain background is just beautiful ... or so i thought 5 seconds ago.

update 10pm: i still don't know how to make an empty line.

update 11pm: today's timelapse log!!!!! title: first html stuff idk man...

update 12am (+1 day): i can now embed a music player!!! so cute :3

update 1am (+1 day): anyways it's for this mysterious page for my (future) gf like i don't wanna jinx it but here we go it's not like i shared this page to anyone except her (only that subpage tho). i hope she doesn't open the main page cuz she might open this post and read this and i'm shy.
